Package pieces

Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.Pawn
public class Pawn extends Piece
Pawn is a subclass of Piece that handles movement behavior of a pawn.
Author:
Prajit Kundu, Howard Luo

  • Method Details

    • legal

      public boolean legal(int fileStart, int rankStart, int fileEnd, int rankEnd, Piece[][] board)
      Method that determines if the move is legal, following the logic of pawn movement. A legal move can be one of the following:
      • One space directly forward (vertical in the direction of the opposing color), so long as the space is empty.
      • Two moves forward if it is the pawn's first move.
      • One space diagonally forward if this space has an opposing piece (this piece is then captured).
      • One space diagonally forward if the adjacent opposing pawn is en passant-able (the opposing pawn is then captured)
      If a pawn moves forward two spaces on its first move, then Piece.enpassantable becomes true. This method handles en passant, moving the pawn executing en passant and removing the opposing pawn from the board. A pawn cannot move backward.
      Specified by:
      legal in class Piece
      Parameters:
      fileStart - file(column) of the piece to be moved
      rankStart - rank(row) of the piece to be moved
      fileEnd - file(column) of the space that the specified piece is to be moved to
      rankEnd - rank(row) of the space that the specified piece is to be moved to
      board - the board state
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal, false if it is not

    • name

      public String name()
      Returns a String "wP" (if the pawn is white) or "bP" (if it is black)
      Specified by:
      name in class Piece
      Returns:
      String formatted "colorType"
